description: This file contains configuration management code for loading MongoDB settings from various sources such as JSON configuration files or environment variables. It defines data structures, validation functions, and a main function to load the settings.

classes.name: MongoSettings
classes.description: Immutable dataclass holding MongoDB connection parameters: URI, database name, and collection name.

methods.name: None _validate_mongo_uri(uri: str)
methods.description: Validates that the MongoDB URI is a non-empty string and starts with 'mongodb://' or 'mongodb+srv://'.

methods.name: None _validate_non_empty(name: str, value: str)
methods.description: Checks that a given string value is non-empty; raises ValueError otherwise.

methods.name: dict _load_json_file(path: str)
methods.description: Loads and parses a JSON file from a given path; raises ValueError on invalid JSON.

methods.name: MongoSettings _from_dict(cfg: dict)
methods.description: Constructs a MongoSettings object from a dictionary, validating required fields.

methods.name: MongoSettings load_mongo_settings()
methods.description: Main public function to load MongoDB settings, trying config files or environment variables in order, with validation.
